title: Is it normal to 'see' the words I’m thinking? - Quora

response.answer_text: I do not think that it's common but I don't think that it's that rare actually. You might have synesthesia which means that you can see and sense things differently. I.e you see the words you imagine. some people can see months as colours and even smell and taste them! Hei hei!

So when you see an apple, do you see an apple, or do you see the word, spelled out in all? If it's the first, I say that's actually pretty common, and that you have a pretty creative mind. If you see the spelling, I'd say that's less common. I believe that means you have more of a logical mind. Personally, I have a logical mind. Hope this helps!
I don't know about normal but it's probably more common than you think. I sometimes get this and I think it comes from an overactive mind.
